address.deliveryPoint: Institute of Arctic and Alpine Research

abstract.para: Lowering of the snowpack surface by ablation (melt) was estimated on a biweekly to weekly basis in the Green Lakes Valley during the summer months. Poles were driven into the snowpack to form transects in several snow-accumulation areas (east face of Arikaree Peak, talus on the north side of Kiowa Peak, rock glacier/wetland between Green Lakes 4 and 5, Arikaree Glacier, Green Lakes 4 and 5, and the Martinelli basin). The height difference (cm) between the snow surface and the top of each pole was recorded. On the subsequent visit the new height difference was recorded and the pole was driven into the snow and the reset height was recorded. Poles in a given transect were relocated as necessary during the course of the season.

description.para: The documentation section of this file was created by Susan Kindig and Rick Ingersoll in late August of 1993.[RCI 30 August 1993] Data for 25 May through 26 August 1993 were added to the data section and this file was put under sccs control on 31 August 1993.[RCI 31 August 1993] Data for 1989 through 1992 were inserted into the data section on 1 September 1993.[RCI 1 September 1993] Data for 2 and 9 September were added to the data section on 30 September 1993.[RCI 30 September 1993] Data for 23 and 30 September and 7 October 1993 were appended to the data section on 14 October 1993.[14 October 1993] The GL5R code was changed to ROCK in the data section to be consistent with other data from the same site that are to be added to this file at a later date.[RCI 5 May 1994] The data section was converted from whitespace- to comma-delimited on 17 May 1994.[RCI 17 May 1994] Data for the years 1969-70 and 1981-86 were inserted into the data section, site code list was updated, and appropriate comments regarding processing were added on 31 May 1994.[RCI 31 May 1994] A comment was added, on 6 July 1994 regarding some of the missing data.[RCI 6 July 1994] The 9999 and 99.99 missing value indicators for time and mean ablation, respectively, were converted to absence of values for consistency with other files in this directory and to conserve space on 13 July 1994. The data for the period from 11 May through 7 July 1994 were appended to the data section on 13 July 1994.[RCI 13 July 1994] Because additional poles were added (or found from previous years and used) for at least 2 of the sites in July and August 1994, it was necessary for re-entry of the 1994 data for those sites. Consequently, all of the 1994 data (through 7 July) were deleted and the re-entered and new 1994 data (through 18 August 1994 were appended to the data section on 12 September 1994.[RCI 12 September 1994] Data for the period 25 August through 13 October 1994 were appended to the data section on 25 October 1994.[RCI 25 October 1994] Data for the period 23 May through 31 August 1995 were appended to the data section on 13 February 1996.[MAH 13 February 1996] Data for the period 16 May 1996 through 17 September 1996 were appended to the data section on 31 March 1997.[MAH 31 March 1997] Data for the period 12 May 1997 through 2 October 1997 were appended to the data section on 24 March 1997.[MAH 24 March 1997] The investigator contact information was updated on 9 June 1999.[MAH 9 June 1999] URL locations for related data were updated on 30 August 2000.[MAH 30 August 2000] Data for the period 04 June 1998 through 24 September 1998 and 17 June through 14 September 1999 were appended to the data section on 30 March 2001.[TMA 30 March 2001] Data for the period 30 May 2000 through 28 September 2000 were appended to the data section on 17 October 2001.[TMA 17 October 2001] Data for the 2001 and 2002 season were appended to the data section.[TMA 23 Apr 2003] Data for 2003 were appended to the data section.[TMA 13 November 2003] Data for 2004 were appended to the data section.[TMA 05 May 2005] Data for 2004 were appended to the data section.[TMA 08 January 2006]
